title.narrative: School Rehabilitation and Support Programme of Baptist Convention Sierra Leone Additional year

description.narrative: The aim of this project is to guarantee the school attendance of elementary school children in three Northern towns of Makeni Lunsar and Gberray Junction. The project consolidates civil society diminishes poverty and encourages people to return to their ho me districts and to overcome the difficulties after the civil war that ended in 2002. As for the crosscutting aims this project advances sexual equality and diminishes unequality. It strengthens schooling in Sierra Leone where many schools are run by churc hes alongside with state run schools. Main beneficiaries area families and school children.During the project carried out in years 2015-2017 school buildings in bad shape were repaired and furnished and additional facilities were build because of the growi ng number of pupils. We want to continue helping those four schools for one more year. We are supporting girls with school uniforms. Poorly paid teachers will receive rice. Some school items will be provided for. We also want to build a new house with two class rooms in Makeni Magbenteh School because of the increase of pupils. We include in this project workshops for teachers in all these four schools because some of their teachers have got a poor training. The leader of these workshops is our project coor dinator Raili Huhtala whose career as teacher and headmaster in Lempaala Commun lasted for more than 30 years.
